segments.text: Hello . I'd like to make a call to Australia .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You can call direct if you like .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Could you please tell me the international prefix and the country code for Australia ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , the code for Australia is 61 and then dial the city code and the number . Start with the international code which is 00 .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What time do the special rates apply ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Between six in the evening and eight in the morning , sir .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I wonder if I can charge this call to my hotel room .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Certainly . Tell me the room number and your name , please ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is Mr . Ma in room 215 .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK , Mr . Ma . I'll tell the front desk clerk the charge afterwards .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thanks very much for your help .
segments.speaker: S2
